definition: To emit a radiant or brilliant light, often associated with the rising or shining of the sun or other celestial bodies. It is commonly used to describe the awe-inspiring moment when the first rays of light illuminate the surroundings, creating a captivating and enchanting atmosphere.

examples.english: The stars shine in the night sky.

examples.german: Die Sonne erstrahlt in voller Pracht.
examples.english: The sun shines in all its glory.

examples.german: Die Stadt erstrahlt im Licht der Laternen.
examples.english: The city is illuminated by the light of the lanterns.
The fireworks light up the sky.

examples.german: Der Diamant erstrahlt in seinem vollen Glanz.
examples.english: The diamond sparkles in its full glory.
